snippet: Using a CT scanner, a team hopes to gather information about the long-perished residents’ habits and lifestyles, and possibly to dispel presumptions.
abstract: Pompeii Journal; diverse team of scientific specialists are attempting to reconstruct lives of Pompeii victims before volcanic eruption destroyed city in 79 AD; are hoping to dispel centuries of unscientific speculation about victims by examining plaster casts made from their bodies using CT scanner, along with laser imaging and DNA tests.
lead_paragraph: Using a CT scanner, a team hopes to gather information about the long-perished residents’ habits and lifestyles, and possibly to dispel presumptions.

headline.print_headline: Researchers, Armed With CT Scanner, Set Out to Demystify Victims of Vesuvius
headline.main: Scientists Hope to Learn How Pompeians Lived, Before the Big Day
